meanings.definition: To strike or come into contact with forcefully
meanings.sent1: He hit the ball with the bat.
meanings.sent2: The hammer hit the nail perfectly.
meanings.sent3: The cat hit the vase, and it crashed to the floor!
meanings.sent4: The storm hit the coast with great power.
meanings.sent5: The boxer's punch hit his opponent hard.

meanings.definition: A successful or popular song, movie, or book
meanings.sent1: The new song by the band became a hit overnight.
meanings.sent2: The movie was a big hit at the box office.
meanings.sent3: The catchy tune of the hit got stuck in everyone's head.
meanings.sent4: The book was a hit among young readers.
meanings.sent5: The artist's latest painting was a hit with the critics.

meanings.sent1: Her prediction about the outcome was a hit.
meanings.sent2: Guessing the right answer on the first try was a hit.
meanings.sent3: His random choice turned out to be a hit in the end.
meanings.sent4: The accurate guess was a hit with everyone present.
meanings.sent5: The lucky hit saved the day for the team.

meanings.sent1: The doctor prescribed a hit of pain medication.
meanings.sent2: He took a hit of the cough syrup to soothe his throat.
meanings.sent3: The nurse administered the hit of medicine to the patient.
meanings.sent4: The pharmacist measured out the exact hit of the prescription.
meanings.sent5: The athlete needed a hit of the performance-enhancing drug.

meanings.definition: A premeditated murder, especially of a public figure
meanings.sent1: The crime scene investigation revealed it was a hit.
meanings.sent2: The hit on the politician shocked the nation.
meanings.sent3: The detective suspected a hit in the high-profile case.
meanings.sent4: The news of the hit spread quickly through the media.
meanings.sent5: The criminal organization planned the hit meticulously.
